page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
IN THE OLD DAYS OF THE VILLAGE THERE WERE FAR MORE FARMS THAN THERE ARE NOW.EVERYBODY IN THE VILLAGE USED TO KEEP AT LEAST SOME DUCKS.MOST PEOPLE WOULD HAVE PIGS,DUCKS,HENS,EVEN COWS.THERE USED TO BE A MAN IN THE VILLAGE WHO WAS A LARGE DUCK FARMER, THE PEOPLE IN THE VILLAGE WOULD REAR DUCKS AND THEN SELL THEM TO THIS MAN, WHO WOULD BUY THEM AND SEND THE TO MARKET,ALONG WITH HIS{TWO THOUSAND.
IN THOSE DAYS THERE WERE FOUR PUBS IN THE VILLAGE.{THE MAGPIE,THE BELL, {THE JOLLY FARMER AND THE WHITE HART WHICH IS THE ONLY ONE THAT IS STILL HERE.
IN THE VILLAGE THERE USED TO BE A THING CALLED THE{COAL HOUSE,}ONCE A YEAR PEOPLE WOULD BE GIVEN COAL FROM THE COUNCIL,OUT OF THE{COAL HOUSE.
